title: The Learning Facilitation Role of Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) in Organizations: A Community of Practice (CoP)-Based Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of organizational learning culture and awareness of ERG theory concepts
context.additional_context: Learners Analyze ERG-Driven Learning Facilitation Mechanisms Based on Practical Experience and Focus on Designing CoP Operation Strategies. Asynchronous Collaboration Using Digital Devices Is Emphasized

learning_goals: Learners can analyze ERG's social identity-based learning activities and propose strategies to enhance member competencies
Learners can design an ERG operational framework based on Communities of Practice (CoP) principles and execute it in an LMS environment
Learners can develop formative assessment tools to evaluate the informal characteristics of ERG learning activities (e.g., perspective shifting, leadership influence)

resources: ERG (Employee Resource Group) Case Study Materials

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
